data.text:
🧵
Today’s all about youth at #COP26. Did you know our 36 #IMFyouth fellows include climate activists and leaders from around the globe? Click here to get to know them more: https://t.co/F1HqZLnMB0 https://t.co/DRyalSOjY4

How can global principles on data—agreed to by all countries—help level the playing field and address financial stability and inclusion, competition, and privacy? Our latest #IMFBlog explains https://t.co/IztTFTewOn https://t.co/bENd5Na82N

In October during a press conference,@KGeorgieva was asked about her message to young people on #climate action & this is what she said: “Speak up. Stand up. Advocate for what is right.” See how the IMF is playing its part to tackle climate change #COP26: https://t.co/7hGQrEuzpS https://t.co/Rnlas1VHHj

Mining is critical to many sub-Saharan African economies, but tax strategies used by multinational firms prevent many governments from collecting their fair share of tax revenue. Read more in our latest #IMFBlog about policies to counter this trend: https://t.co/zRcsbj1tFZ https://t.co/Vkr5RDgIdN

Dominica is determined to become the first climate-resilient country by 2030 and is investing heavily to “disaster-proof” its buildings and infrastructure. https://t.co/su7PjviohY #FandD #COP26 https://t.co/3VAxAFf6zw
What is unemployment? Can demand and supply explain unemployment? Check out our explainer video. https://t.co/kGB0Uom1lW #jobs https://t.co/p9HkDvJOa4
#Finland is leading the way in replacing fossil-based chemicals with renewable raw materials like wood. Read more in our latest Country Focus. https://t.co/OxuqQM2faK #COP26 https://t.co/7JLmqcwZUG
LIVE: This year's Mundell-Fleming Lecture, presented by @UCBerkeley's Pierre-Olivier Gourinchas. https://t.co/T2HcIIBHLU #ARCPolak https://t.co/Te3BufKtnh

Countries subsidize fossil fuels in 2 ways: undercharge for the product or for other costs such as damage to the planet and people’s health.
  
Read the analysis on the real cost of energy subsidies and what countries can do to reform the system #COP26 https://t.co/h4X4fA00zu https://t.co/yG4zr3lxQw

Loan accounts and borrowers at #microfinance institutions declined in some countries during the COVID-19 pandemic. Check out our latest Survey for a global snapshot of trends and developments on #FinancialAccess. https://t.co/uFsRzzTxYi https://t.co/OljRpdRnx4
IMF updated estimates put the global cost of fossil fuel subsidies at $5.9 trillion in 2020, up from $5.2 trillion in 2017 #COP26 #climateaction https://t.co/h4X4fA00zu https://t.co/rcIeRDdqwR

🔴 Live NOW: A conversation between @GitaGopinath and @ChicagoBooth’s Raghuram Rajan on vaccines, the recovery, and policies in advanced economies and emerging markets. https://t.co/T2HcIIk6nk #ARCPolak https://t.co/P3AlZrkBbw
Managing Director @KGeorgieva opens the 22nd IMF Annual Research Conference. Check out the program of events here: https://t.co/T2HcIIk6nk #ARCPolak https://t.co/TwYCJ4Oo73

📅 SAVE THE DATE: IMF Managing Director @KGeorgieva will discuss the evolving nature of the EU budget at the Annual EU Budget Conference with @Sam1Fleming and @JHahnEU. Monday, 11/08 at 8:40AM ET: https://t.co/5acf8Yjp3b 
#NextGenerationEU

Among other measures, the gradual removal of fossil fuel subsidies and the introduction of universal carbon taxes could help some countries in #LatinAmerica and the Caribbean meet their climate goals. Read more in this #IMFBlog: https://t.co/yJdFIISqau #COP26 https://t.co/6OfFGbvU8H

The IMF’s Bo Li at #COP26: Carbon pricing, green investments, and a just transition remain three key global policy priorities; there’s still a lot of room for the public sector to act and support the private sector. https://t.co/HoF1rLnmGm

Join @KGeorgieva on Nov. 4 at 10 AM in Baku (GMT+4) for the opening ceremony of @NizamiGanjaviIC's 8th Global Baku Forum: The World After COVID-19.
📺 https://t.co/toQIRJm35E https://t.co/V4w6PZ8x0w

Tune in Thursday, November 4 at 11:00 AM ET for a conversation with @GitaGopinath and @ChicagoBooth’s Raghuram Rajan on vaccines, the recovery, and policies in advanced economies and emerging markets. https://t.co/T2HcIIk6nk #ARCPolak
https://t.co/P3AlZrkBbw

An international #carbon price floor should be equitable and pragmatic. Read the details in remarks by Kristalina Georgieva at #COP26 
https://t.co/sfhGnC3VSR https://t.co/vK1DJeQfjn

Companies around the world are running a digital data gold rush, with power concentrated in a few hands, posing risks to growth and stability. Our new  #IMFBlog sheds some light on what countries need to do: https://t.co/IztTFTewOn https://t.co/lpw2FG2RqW

It’s time for the IMF Annual Research Conference! Join us for 2 days of sessions with researchers & policymakers on how to: boost economic growth, restore confidence following the pandemic, and more. Check out our lineup & tune in Nov 4-5: https://t.co/T2HcIIk6nk #ARCPolak https://t.co/H5fg9j7Hpl
An international #carbon price floor should be equitable and pragmatic. Read more about carbon pricing in remarks by @KGeorgieva at #COP26 https://t.co/sfhGnC3VSR https://t.co/LNlK3ZPTO0
LIVE 🎥: The IMF is helping countries identify and assess the financial risks and opportunities of #climate change. Kristalina Georgieva speaks at #COP26: https://t.co/upOPdZsgxA
🟢LIVE NOW watch Kristalina Georgieva at #COP26 discuss financing and investing in a just transition to net zero global emissions. https://t.co/v1QVsuzQwt https://t.co/qoUJOb5TK7

📅 Join us November 4-5 for the 22nd #ARCPolak conference. Watch LIVE sessions with @GitaGopinath, @ChicagoBooth’s Raghuram Rajan, @UCBerkeley’s Pierre-Olivier Gourinchas, and more https://t.co/T2HcIIBHLU https://t.co/ZHfKutMNKC
More discussion on this and other climate-related topics at this year’s #StatsForum on “Measuring Climate Change” https://t.co/sUi65ryyZk https://t.co/MiMfeVAvBL

New IMF staff research shows how tracking trade and #supply chains from space could show disruptions even earlier, including those caused by #climate change. Read the details in the new #IMFBlog: https://t.co/75JNJJ2zN2 https://t.co/shGj70v352
The IMF has global support to create a new financial instrument to help vulnerable countries fight and adapt to #climate change. https://t.co/MeRK40Lh4a https://t.co/NGrkSV02Zd

The cost to mitigate #climate change is manageable. To put global carbon emissions within range of a 2° C target would cost 0.2 to 1.2% of GDP. Benefits include fewer deaths from local air pollution #COP26. https://t.co/kM2k2ok60E https://t.co/cCg4fdWfIY
🟢LIVE NOW: @KGeorgieva joins @POTUS and global leaders for the launch of the global methane pledge, today in Glasgow. Tune in to watch here:  https://t.co/KxhInMLgLG https://t.co/0SReXgcjSB

To achieve the cuts to carbon emissions needed to keep global warming below 2° C, policymakers meeting at #COP26 in Glasgow must address twin gaps in ambition and policy. Read the details in the latest #IMFBlog. https://t.co/LW4QDsQJKq https://t.co/6l1YqDHPmM

LIVE NOW: @KGeorgieva discusses carbon pricing with @WorldBank @Mari_Pangestu  @EU_Commission @vonderleyen #Canada’s @JustinTrudeau, @SwedishPM and @MarkJCarney during #COP26. Watch the conversation here:
https://t.co/O7dG6Fg3cT https://t.co/WslPJtiqOU

The IMF works with vulnerable countries to help them assess their risks to #climate change and develop strategies to lessen the impact on people and economies. #COP26 https://t.co/FYp5tHj5Vg https://t.co/cbfvlAaLbC

📆 SAVE THE DATE: Tune in November 4-5 for the 22nd IMF Annual Research Conference. This year's #ARCPolak gathering will focus on strategies for a resilient recovery to boost economic growth and reduce income inequality among and within countries. https://t.co/T2HcIIk6nk https://t.co/sY3ndMUVjW
.@KGeorgieva spoke to world leaders during #COP26 today. Read her remarks about the IMF’s work to help countries adapt to #climate change. https://t.co/FYp5tHj5Vg https://t.co/Q2pKUPtKhd

A global carbon price over $75 per ton would be needed by 2030 to keep warming below 2° C. Read the latest analysis on the impact of #climate change, as #COP26 kicks off: https://t.co/LW4QDsQJKq https://t.co/hKHI0OvtOk

Countries’ pledges to get to net zero carbon emissions by 2050 fall short of the goal.  New IMF staff research shows that even with advanced economies expected to cut emissions more rapidly, everyone has to do more. #COP26
Read the new #IMFBlog: https://t.co/LW4QDsQJKq https://t.co/SzOYOg41nA

Social distancing and lockdowns increased the use of digital financial services. Learn about the role of #MobileMoney and #MobileBanking during the pandemic in our 2021 Financial Access Survey. https://t.co/uFsRzzTxYi https://t.co/BggdYqCjMm
.@KGeorgieva will address the #COP26 World Leaders’ Summit on November 1, at 12:50 PM ET (4:50 PM GMT). Watch live here: https://t.co/XWzUFm1gQH https://t.co/7YZLnPmECK

New IMF staff analysis in time for #COP26 shows gaps in ambition and policies needed to curb emissions to contain global warming.  Read the details and get the data:  https://t.co/NeGxZ3alXw https://t.co/mGmfPsRGwg

A new #IMFBlog by @KGeorgieva on #climate change shows unchanged global policies will leave 2030 carbon emissions far higher than needed to “keep 1.5 alive.” https://t.co/LW4QDsQJKq https://t.co/nbrTKxPXNd

Countries pledge around $45 billion to channel part of their #SDR allocations to the IMF Poverty Reduction and Growth Trust and the Resilience and Sustainability Trust.  Read the full @g20org communiqué here: https://t.co/qfvrEKQpT7 https://t.co/2hV6tFT2nK

Time is running out to tackle climate change. We’re heading to #COP26 to support ambitious #climateaction now. Check out our new COP26 page online to learn more: https://t.co/7hGQrEcYyk https://t.co/yXh67coziq

Latin America and the Caribbean will need to transform their economies to fight and adapt to #climatechange, which also offers opportunities. Want to learn more? Read the new #IMFBlog: https://t.co/yJdFIISqau 

#IMFAmericas #COP26 https://t.co/K0AqSrFq13
Quantum computing: trick or treat? Read about its possibilities and perils here, in #FandD. https://t.co/wb43qJPuSK https://t.co/yqiVJAJIlk

Investing in climate-resilient infrastructure will strengthen countries’ ability to adapt to #climatechange and can boost GDP in the long run in #LatinAmerica and the Caribbean. Learn more in the latest #IMFBlog: https://t.co/yJdFIISqau #IMFAmericas https://t.co/hvifWMEeYa
Fossil fuel subsidies are in the news and as we get ready for #COP26 here is a recent analysis of the cost to people and the economy: https://t.co/axKZxOT39m https://t.co/UoAiGfNXm0
We talk a lot about putting a price on carbon, but what does it mean and how does it work? https://t.co/NO27I2APhu https://t.co/sNFZ6ErVHo
Quantum computing: trick or treat? Read about its possibilities and perils here, in #FandD. https://t.co/wb43qJPuSK https://t.co/rASWOE0aUK

Strengthening the credibility of public finances would help countries manage higher debt. Watch IMF’s Raphael Espinoza discussing the latest #FiscalMonitor with Giancarlo Corsetti @Cambridge_Uni and @bweder, @cepr_org @IHEID  https://t.co/yDiFXtMqUk

Among other measures, the gradual removal of fossil fuel subsidies and the introduction of universal carbon taxes could help some countries in #LatinAmerica and the Caribbean meet their climate goals. Read more in our latest #IMFBlog: https://t.co/yJdFIISqau #IMFAmericas https://t.co/qkfMqDXG72

Check out our new playlist of the 5 best @imf_podcast on climate change, covering everything from making it cheaper to go green, to chimpanzees.  You can tune in here: https://t.co/QVtTByIZ6h https://t.co/0QcR47HINT

#LatinAmerica and the Caribbean will need to transform their economies to fight and adapt to #climatechange, which also offers opportunities. Want to learn more? Read the new #IMFBlog: https://t.co/yJdFIISqau #IMFAmericas https://t.co/flFdaTZyZr

We’ll see you in Glasgow @UNFCCC and we’ve got lots more new policy analysis and data on #climate change to share. Stay tuned for more.

📜https://t.co/7n9uhTw1zK https://t.co/FSJxbHnY1h

ICYMI | A discussion on the state of the recovery in the #Caucasus and #CentralAsia. Panelists discussed the new economic challenges that are emerging, plus the policies that can help the region secure a stronger, fairer recovery. https://t.co/1Qwtg2avql

https://t.co/h6If3hCKSQ

Last year, the IMF trained nearly 15,000 government officials and delivered 360 courses in eight languages. Read more in the #IMFAnnualReport. #BuildForwardBetter https://t.co/R7hfOzYjja https://t.co/E86hiGL7eH
In case you missed it, check out #FandD’s special Fall #climate issue, produced in partnership with @COP26: https://t.co/ogwtgFhVpi #COP26 https://t.co/2nB3wm5NRI

Private sector financing can play a pivotal role in amplifying the effects of government climate policies, writes Citi’s @ValCookSmith in #FandD: https://t.co/U9zA7tCSHo #COP26 https://t.co/IhhHRLiGG4

According to the @IEA, sub-Saharan Africa needs around $28 billion annually to close the energy access gap. Benson Ireri and @RebekahGShirley on how to close this gap. https://t.co/Q0BzcxVGXM #FandD #COP26 https://t.co/lym3rGdnko

Our new report to @g20org leaders details country-by-country policies that could boost aggregate real GDP in the #G20 by about $4.9 trillion through 2026. Read the blog with all the details: https://t.co/cTRF2gD33f https://t.co/aLstffhqwn

Putting a robust price on carbon lies at the heart of any comprehensive package of policies to fight #ClimateChange. As @COP26 starts next week, @g20org leadership is critical to build support for an international approach. https://t.co/cTRF2gD33f https://t.co/G8yQQTPG34

COVID19 remains the biggest risk to the global economy, but we are still behind global vaccination targets. @g20org leaders must act boldly at the #G20RomeSummit to get back on track. @KGeorgieva outlines how in a new #IMFBlog https://t.co/cTRF2gD33f https://t.co/5Us7y2F67G

A new #IMFBlog by @KGeorgieva calls for #G20 action to end the pandemic & spur growth: close COVID financing gaps & share vaccines, help developing countries financially, and commit to a comprehensive package to reach net-zero carbon emissions by 2050. https://t.co/cTRF2gD33f https://t.co/cw4I0DkEbD

We have all experienced the effects of global supply chain disruptions. Our Chart of the Week illustrates how these disruptions have led to longer delivery times and examines the prospects for the future. https://t.co/2V9HYqqdEy #IMFBlog https://t.co/rjY80JQVvt

Chief Economist @GitaGopinath summarizes the main findings of the World Economic Outlook, the risks facing the world, and our policy recommendations. https://t.co/KnxQBjiK2u #WEO https://t.co/ydKUX0vkTD

Many countries in the Middle East and North Africa region face tough policy decisions as they manage the pandemic. Now is also the time to invest in sustainable, inclusive, and green growth. https://t.co/1Qwtg2avql https://t.co/15MCrIuHYj
🟣 Join our @TwitterSpaces with @aselassie and @gyude_moore on the economic outlook for sub-Saharan Africa. https://t.co/v7LG8bhIfC #IMFAfrica https://t.co/hx5Wivhg7h
WATCH: IMF chief economist @GitaGopinath on the 3 things you need to know about our work to help countries tackle #climate change. https://t.co/7hGQrEuzpS https://t.co/57iI1zukWe

A variety of measures such as longer time in school, support for digitalization, promotion of smart use of technology while protecting public funding for education could help reverse setback due to prolonged school closures in the LAC region. https://t.co/4kyW86rsmP #IMFAmericas https://t.co/woRBzBcwU5

Join us today, at 1:30 PM ET (5:30 PM GMT) for a @TwitterSpaces on the economic outlook for sub-Saharan Africa, with @aselassie and @gyude_moore. Click/tap on the link to set a reminder and join. ⬇️ https://t.co/hx5Wivhg7h

How can global principles on data—agreed to by all countries—help level the playing field and address financial stability and inclusion, competition, and privacy? Our latest #IMFBlog explains https://t.co/IztTFTewOn https://t.co/9viKxVDRn6
Meet Berkeley’s Solomon Hsiang, who uses big data to inform #climatechange policies. Profiled in the latest #FandD: https://t.co/9N77QGM8SD #COP26 https://t.co/SdWM3Gl4WJ

Sub-Saharan Africa is recovering slower than other regions and is unlikely to regain lost ground anytime soon. Read our latest IMF Country Focus to find out more about the outlook for the region. https://t.co/cxB13QuL5j #IMFAfrica https://t.co/of5xWY7fGn
Disruptions to global supply chains illustrated and explained in the latest #IMFBlog. https://t.co/KrBgDHBVkD https://t.co/jUUz6a4OLx

Policy measures that can help #LatAm & the Caribbean reach its climate goals:

✅Raise price of carbon
✅Invest in low-carbon technologies 
✅Adopt supportive regulations
✅Promote nature-based solutions
✅Invest in resilient infrastructure

https://t.co/4kyW86rsmP #IMFAmericas https://t.co/uMyYbwqEjq

Many developing countries struggle to convert vaccine contracts to actual deliveries, making it difficult to vaccinate 40% of the population by the end of 2021. 

@Ruchir_Agar outlines how to make that happen and end the pandemic. ➡️ https://t.co/Knivhlbr4F https://t.co/MJknBIwnP8

STARTING SOON: IMF Chief @KGeorgieva discusses 3 priorities for action to boost resilience to climate change in #Africa & improve people’s livelihoods at @GCAdaptation’s Africa Adaptation Acceleration event, moderated by @citizentvkenya's @YvonneOkwara https://t.co/kAewQGkliN

The IMF projects the global economy to grow at 5.9% in 2021 and 4.9% in 2022, 0.1 percentage points lower for 2021 than the July forecast. 

More in the latest World Economic Outlook ➡️ https://t.co/j0FIiCr9li #WEO https://t.co/SKojcofFyw
Suppliers’ delivery times in the US and EU have hit record highs, reflecting surging demand and widespread supply shortages. https://t.co/KrBgDHBVkD #IMFBlog https://t.co/LJlTO2ahYk
The IMF’s Vitor Gaspar, explains how the pandemic affected global debt #FiscalMonitor Learn more: https://t.co/4yV6zroLRJ https://t.co/1mIDBKpIRn

We forecast growth for emerging market and developing economies at 6.4% in 2021, a marginal revision from our July forecast. Growth will moderate to 5.1% in 2022. Read the latest World Economic Outlook to learn more: https://t.co/hYpP2Ag5d6 #WEO. https://t.co/23AqmW7Xdj

Join us on Tuesday, October 26, 2021, at 1:30 PM ET (5:30 PM GMT) for a Twitter Space on the economic outlook for sub-Saharan Africa. Click/tap on the link to set a reminder and join ➡️  https://t.co/hx5Wivhg7h

IMF Projections: 2021

🇦🇴Angola: –0.7%
🇨🇮Côte d’Ivoire: 6.0%
🇬🇭Ghana: 4.7%
🇪🇹Ethiopia: 2.0%
🇰🇪Kenya: 5.6%
🇳🇬Nigeria: 2.6%
🇷🇼Rwanda: 5.1%
🇸🇳Senegal: 4.7%
🇿🇦South Africa: 5.0%
🇹🇿Tanzania: 4.0%
🇺🇬Uganda: 4.7%
🇿🇲Zambia: 1.0%

Latest analysis & projections ➡️ https://t.co/nPhQ7iPL0u https://t.co/4VnuC5wWYY

The ‘great vaccine divide’ & large disparities in policy support are driving divergences between countries. While almost 60% of the population in advanced economies are fully vaccinated, about 96% in low-income countries remain unvaccinated. https://t.co/oIzPyGqani #WEO #IMFblog https://t.co/Nm8kKvmrhs

The pandemic will leave a lasting mark on government finances, inequality, and poverty. Our new #ChartsinMotion shows how government debt will exceed pre-pandemic projections. Learn more on our #IMFblog → https://t.co/za1TC6u7uX https://t.co/Ot58isC0dE

Why should countries invest in basic scientific research? Our latest World Economic Outlook estimates that a 10% permanent increase in a country’s stock of basic scientific research can increase productivity by 0.3%. https://t.co/KnxQBj19aW #WEO https://t.co/fjpb0saduW

Resurgent inflation around the world is likely to be temporary, though IMF staff say that there are risks of a pickup. In the latest #IMFBlog, we explore the risk. https://t.co/4PoJCzMCto https://t.co/v3ly6sOrBV

The number one priority for sub-Saharan Africa’s economic recovery is exiting the pandemic. And for this to happen, there must be international cooperation on vaccination to reach the global targets. https://t.co/nPhQ7iPL0u #IMFAfrica https://t.co/H9Gcm7HDQS

Climate change presents both challenges & opportunities for the LAC region. A transition to greener, more resilient economies could help achieve economic, social & environmental sustainability while fostering opportunities for economic and social growth. https://t.co/4kyW86rsmP https://t.co/B7ruCTx6YZ

Join @KGeorgieva today at 9:25 AM ET for a conversation with @Gi_Saudi on Reinventing Financing for the Green Transition: New Perspectives or Business as Usual?

📍 https://t.co/gkYC5k7jrB

IMF Projection for LAC region: 2021

🇦🇷 Argentina: 7.5%
🇦🇼 Aruba: 12.8%
🇧🇷 Brazil: 5.2%
🇨🇱 Chile: 11.0%
🇨🇴 Colombia: 7.6%
🇨🇷 Costa Rica: 3.9%
🇬🇾 Guyana: 20.4%
🇯🇲 Jamaica: 4.6%
🇲🇽 Mexico: 6.2%
🇵🇪 Peru: 10.0%
🇻🇪 Venezuela: -5.0%

Latest analysis https://t.co/4kyW86rsmP #IMFAmericas https://t.co/QowUiclVxi
Soaring natural gas prices are rippling through global energy markets and causing complications for factories and utilities. Learn more on #IMFBlog: https://t.co/AYqODLkmXi https://t.co/TGVK2jbjwc

Increasing vaccinations & a strong recovery in major trading partners like China, Europe, & US are supporting the recovery & creating conditions for consumer demand to rise—as governments gradually reduce policy support.

Regional Economic Outlook for LAC https://t.co/7igUb1W4Rt https://t.co/4bLJBK3k8C

The emergence of COVID-19 variants, rising global interest rates, and social unrest in Latin America and the Caribbean may pose a risk to the region’s economic outlook. https://t.co/4kyW86rsmP #IMFAmericas https://t.co/fbRlt8ESqf
Private sector financing can play a pivotal role in amplifying the effects of government climate policies, writes Citi’s @ValCookSmith for #FandD: https://t.co/U9zA7tCSHo https://t.co/0gWUUh7RRD

How can Asia reignite its growth engine through trade liberalization? The latest regional economic outlook report dives into the potential gains from reducing nontariff barriers—using a novel index. Read the new report at https://t.co/FkepWlp2ug https://t.co/4YstomaQFw

🆕 Check out our #COP26 page to see why the IMF is participating and to learn more about our work on #climate change. @COP26

🔗 https://t.co/7hGQrEcYyk https://t.co/PwqgRONHP7

An economic recovery is under way in #LatinAmerica and the Caribbean with real GPD projected to grow by 6.3% in 2021 and by 3% in 2022. However, the recovery has been uneven in the region and is far from complete. https://t.co/p00hyZg1xZ #IMFAmericas https://t.co/aDFteli33h
